Key Arguments: The draft bill should be scrapped immediately.
People should have access to all information to evaluate and determine for themselves what is true or false.
It is a fundamental right in a free society for individuals to discern fact from fiction.
No entity should have the power to decide what is and isn't disinformation.
The bill is perceived as a means to control the population through brainwashing and deception.
The bill is associated with international organizations that are seen as threats to national sovereignty.
Notable Quotes: In a proper functioning society people need to have all information available to them, they can then evaluate and determine for themselves what is real (true) information and what is dis-information.
The intention of any such bill can only be to control the population by means of brainwashing and deception.
